summary: This document is a chain of emails from September 2020 between Marc A. Weinstein, an attorney for the Epstein Estate, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY. The correspondence concerns the SDNY's request for a transcript of a 2009 deposition of a plaintiff (name redacted) from a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein, and the legal steps needed to provide it due to potential confidentiality restrictions.

persons.context: He was the attorney for the plaintiff in the 2009 civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. The SDNY and Weinstein seek to connect with him to confirm no protective order exists and to obtain a waiver.

events.title: Civil Deposition of Plaintiff
events.description: A deposition was taken of a plaintiff in a civil lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. The transcript of this deposition is the subject of the SDNY's 2020 request.

events.title: SDNY Requests Call Regarding Transcript
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the SDNY emails Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback to schedule a call regarding obtaining a transcript.

events.title: SDNY Identifies Case Details
events.description: The AUSA provides details of the sought transcript: the plaintiff's name (redacted), their attorney Jack Scarola, the year (2009), and Epstein's attorneys (Luttier and Critton).

events.title: Confidentiality Concerns and Initial Waiver
events.description: Weinstein raises concerns about a potential protective order. The AUSA later reports that plaintiff's counsel (Scarola) is unaware of any such order.

events.title: Request for Formal Waiver
events.description: Weinstein requests a formal letter/email from the plaintiff's attorney waiving any confidentiality provisions to allow the transcript's release to the US Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: The SDNY was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein in September 2020, seeking evidence from a 2009 civil lawsuit deposition.
The plaintiff's name in the 2009 case is redacted throughout the document, but their attorney was Jack Scarola.
Jeffrey Epstein was represented in the 2009 deposition by attorneys Mark Luttier and Bob Critton of Critton, Luttier, and Coleman LLP.
The Epstein Estate, through attorney Marc Weinstein, possessed the 2009 deposition transcript and was cooperating with the SDNY's request, subject to resolving confidentiality concerns.
The correspondence shows a legal process where the SDNY sought a formal waiver from the plaintiff's former attorney to obtain the transcript without violating any potential protective orders.
